title: Apache HTTP Server mod_proxy remote code execution
description: The Apache HTTP Server is vulnerable to a request smuggling flaw that allows remote code execution.
remediation: Apply Apache HTTP Server 2.4.56 or later and enable request header normalization.
evidence: Matched response headers indicate vulnerable version.

title: Outdated TLS cipher suites on customer portal
description: The customer portal accepts deprecated TLS 1.0 connections with RC4-based cipher suites.
remediation: Disable legacy protocols and enforce TLS 1.2+ with AES-GCM cipher suites.
evidence: Qualys SSL Labs scan grade B; RC4-SHA negotiated.

title: Microsoft SMBv3 compression remote code execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in SMBv3 when handling compressed packets.
remediation: Install Microsoft's security update KB4551762 or later.

title: Kubernetes API server allows anonymous access
description: The Kubernetes API server permits unauthenticated requests to sensitive endpoints.
remediation: Disable anonymous-auth and tighten RBAC roles for the API server.

title: Public S3 bucket exposes customer invoices
description: An Amazon S3 bucket hosting monthly invoices is publicly listable and allows anonymous downloads.
remediation: Apply bucket policies to restrict access to authenticated IAM principals and enable logging.

title: Excessive SSH login failures on production database
description: System logs indicate a sustained brute-force attempt targeting the production database host.
remediation: Enable MFA for privileged accounts and block offending source IPs.
